name: xenorchestra
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Xen Orchestra cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`xenorchestra` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vatesfr/terraform-provider-xenorchestra).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Xen Orchestra cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vatesfr/terraform-provider-xenorchestra)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-xenorchestra` repo](https://github.com/vatesfr/pulumi-xenorchestra/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-xenorchestra` repo](https://github.com/vatesfr/terraform-provider-xenorchestra/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vatesfr/terraform-provider-xenorchestra)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-xenorchestra` repo](https://github.com/vatesfr/pulumi-xenorchestra/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-xenorchestra` repo](https://github.com/vatesfr/terraform-provider-xenorchestra/issues).

insecure.description: Whether SSL should be verified or not. Can be set via the XOA_INSECURE environment variable.

password.description: Password for xoa api. Can be set via the XOA_PASSWORD environment variable.

retryMaxTime.description: If `retry_mode` is set, this specifies the duration for which the backoff method will continue retries. Can be set via the `XOA_RETRY_MAX_TIME` environment variable

retryMode.description: Specifies if retries should be attempted for requests that require eventual . Can be set via the XOA_RETRY_MODE environment variable.

token.description: Password for xoa api. Can be set via the XOA_TOKEN environment variable.

url.description: Hostname of the xoa router. Can be set via the XOA_URL environment variable.

username.description: User account for xoa api. Can be set via the XOA_USER environment variable.

quantity.description: The numerical limit for the given type.

type.description: The type of resource set limit. Must be cpus, memory or disk.

id.description: The ID of the ISO (VDI) to attach to the VM. This can be easily provided by using the `vdi` data source.

attached.description: Whether the device should be attached to the VM.

nameLabel.description: The name for the disk

position.description: Indicates the order of the block device.

size.description: The size in bytes for the disk.

srId.description: The storage repository ID to use.

attached.description: Whether the device should be attached to the VM.

expectedIpCidr.description: Determines the IP CIDR range the provider will wait for on this network interface. Resource creation is not complete until an IP address within the specified range becomes available. This parameter replaces the former `wait_for_ip` functionality. This only works if guest-tools are installed in the VM. Defaults to "", which skips IP address matching.

networkId.description: The ID of the network the VM will be on.

cpus.description: CPU information about the host. The 'cores' key will contain the number of cpu cores and the 'sockets' key will contain the number of sockets.

memory.description: The memory size of the host.

memoryUsage.description: The memory usage of the host.

nameLabel.description: The name label of the host.

poolId.description: Id of the pool that the host belongs to.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

affinityHost.description: The preferred host you would like the VM to run on. If changed on an existing VM it will require a reboot for the VM to be rescheduled.

autoPoweron.description: If the VM will automatically turn on. Defaults to `false`.

blockedOperations.description: List of operations on a VM that are not permitted. Examples include: clean_reboot, clean_shutdown, hard_reboot, hard_shutdown, pause, shutdown, suspend, destroy. See: https://xapi-project.github.io/xen-api/classes/vm.html#enum_vm_operations

cloneType.description: The type of clone to perform for the VM. Possible values include `fast` or `full` and defaults to `fast`. In order to perform a `full` clone, the VM template must not be a disk template.

cloudConfig.description: The content of the cloud-init config to use. See the cloud init docs for more [information](https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/examples.html).

cloudNetworkConfig.description: The content of the cloud-init network configuration for the VM (uses [version 1](https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/network-config-format-v1.html))

cpus.description:
The number of CPUs the VM will have. Updates to this field will cause a stop and start of the VM if the new CPU value is greater than the max CPU value. This can be determined with the following command:
```

$ xo-cli xo.getAllObjects filter='json:{"id": "cf7b5d7d-3cd5-6b7c-5025-5c935c8cd0b8"}' | jq '.[].CPUs'
{
  "max": 4,
  "number": 2
}

# Updating the VM to use 3 CPUs would happen without stopping/starting the VM
# Updating the VM to use 5 CPUs would stop/start the VM
```

disks.description: The disk the VM will have access to.

expNestedHvm.description: Boolean parameter that allows a VM to use nested virtualization.

highAvailability.description: The restart priority for the VM. Possible values are `best-effort`, `restart` and empty string (no restarts on failure. Defaults to empty string

hvmBootFirmware.description: The firmware to use for the VM. Possible values are `bios` and `uefi`.

ipv6Addresses.description: This is only accessible if guest-tools is installed in the VM. While the output contains a list of ipv6 addresses, the presence of an IP address is only guaranteed if `expected_ip_cidr` is set for that interface. The list contains the ipv6 addresses across all network interfaces in order.

memoryMax.description: The amount of memory in bytes the VM will have.\n\n!!! WARNING: Updates to this field will cause the VM to stop and start, as it sets both dynamic and static maximums.

memoryMin.description: The amount of memory in bytes the VM will have. Set this value equal to memory_max to have a static memory.

nameLabel.description: The name of the VM.

powerState.description: The power state of the VM. This can be Running, Halted, Paused or Suspended.

secureBoot.description: Enable UEFI secure boot for the VM.

startDelay.description: Number of seconds the VM should be delayed from starting.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

template.description: The ID of the VM template to create the new VM from.

vga.description: The video adapter the VM should use. Possible values include std and cirrus.

videoram.description: The videoram option the VM should use. Possible values include 1, 2, 4, 8, 16

xenstore.description: The key value pairs to be populated in xenstore.

attached.description: Whether the device should be attached to the VM.

nameLabel.description: The name for the disk

position.description: Indicates the order of the block device.

size.description: The size in bytes for the disk.

srId.description: The storage repository ID to use.

attached.description: Whether the device should be attached to the VM.

expectedIpCidr.description: Determines the IP CIDR range the provider will wait for on this network interface. Resource creation is not complete until an IP address within the specified range becomes available. This parameter replaces the former `wait_for_ip` functionality. This only works if guest-tools are installed in the VM. Defaults to "", which skips IP address matching.

networkId.description: The ID of the network the VM will be on.

provider.description:
The provider type for the xenorchestra package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

insecure.description: Whether SSL should be verified or not. Can be set via the XOA_INSECURE environment variable.

password.description: Password for xoa api. Can be set via the XOA_PASSWORD environment variable.

retryMaxTime.description: If `retry_mode` is set, this specifies the duration for which the backoff method will continue retries. Can be set via the `XOA_RETRY_MAX_TIME` environment variable

retryMode.description: Specifies if retries should be attempted for requests that require eventual . Can be set via the XOA_RETRY_MODE environment variable.

token.description: Password for xoa api. Can be set via the XOA_TOKEN environment variable.

url.description: Hostname of the xoa router. Can be set via the XOA_URL environment variable.

username.description: User account for xoa api. Can be set via the XOA_USER environment variable.

action.description: Must be one of admin, operator, viewer. See the [Xen orchestra docs](https://xen-orchestra.com/docs/acls.html) on ACLs for more details.

object.description: The id of the object that will be able to be used by the subject.

subject.description: The uuid of the user account that the acl will apply to.

name.description: The name of the cloud config.

template.description: The cloud init config. See the cloud init docs for more [information](https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/examples.html).

name.description: The name of the cloud config.

name.description: The name of the cloud config.

limits.description: The limit applied to the resource set.

name.description: The name of the resource set.

objects.description: The uuids of the objects that are within scope of the resource set. A minimum of a storage repository, network and VM template are required for users to launch VMs.

subjects.description: The uuids of the user accounts that should have access to the resource set.

filepath.description: The file path to the ISO or vdi image that should be uploaded when the VDI is created.

nameLabel.description: The name label of the VDI

srId.description: The id of the storage repository the VDI should be created in. Make sure the storage repository supports the file you are uploading! For example, ISOs should only be uploaded to ISO storage repositories.

type.description: Only `raw` uploads are supported today, but vhd support may be added in the future.

autoPoweron.description: If the VM will automatically turn on. Defaults to `false`.

cdrom.description: The ISO that should be attached to VM. This allows you to create a VM from a diskless template (any templates available from `xe template-list`) and install the OS from the following ISO.

cloneType.description: The type of clone to perform for the VM. Possible values include `fast` or `full` and defaults to `fast`. In order to perform a `full` clone, the VM template must not be a disk template.

cloudConfig.description: The content of the cloud-init config to use. See the cloud init docs for more [information](https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/examples.html).

cloudNetworkConfig.description: The content of the cloud-init network configuration for the VM (uses [version 1](https://cloudinit.readthedocs.io/en/latest/topics/network-config-format-v1.html))

cpus.description:
The number of CPUs the VM will have. Updates to this field will cause a stop and start of the VM if the new CPU value is greater than the max CPU value. This can be determined with the following command:
```

$ xo-cli xo.getAllObjects filter='json:{"id": "cf7b5d7d-3cd5-6b7c-5025-5c935c8cd0b8"}' | jq '.[].CPUs'
{
  "max": 4,
  "number": 2
}

# Updating the VM to use 3 CPUs would happen without stopping/starting the VM
# Updating the VM to use 5 CPUs would stop/start the VM
```

destroyCloudConfigVdiAfterBoot.description: Determines whether the cloud config VDI should be deleted once the VM has booted. Defaults to `false`. If set to `true`, power_state must be set to `Running`.

disks.description: The disk the VM will have access to.

expNestedHvm.description: Boolean parameter that allows a VM to use nested virtualization.

highAvailability.description: The restart priority for the VM. Possible values are `best-effort`, `restart` and empty string (no restarts on failure. Defaults to empty string

hvmBootFirmware.description: The firmware to use for the VM. Possible values are `bios` and `uefi`.

installationMethod.description: This cannot be used with `cdrom`. Possible values are `network` which allows a VM to boot via PXE.

ipv6Addresses.description: This is only accessible if guest-tools is installed in the VM. While the output contains a list of ipv6 addresses, the presence of an IP address is only guaranteed if `expected_ip_cidr` is set for that interface. pulumi:providers:xenorchestra/terraformC.description: This function returns a Terraform config object with terraform-namecased keys,to be used with the Terraform Module Provider.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaCloudConfig.

name.description: The name of the cloud config you want to look up.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaCloudConfig.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of the cloud config you want to look up.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaHost.

nameLabel.description: The name label of the host.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaHost.

cpus.description: CPU information about the host. The 'cores' key will contain the number of cpu cores and the 'sockets' key will contain the number of sockets.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

memory.description: The memory size of the host.

memoryUsage.description: The memory usage of the host.

nameLabel.description: The name label of the host.

poolId.description: Id of the pool that the host belongs to.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

xenorchestra:index/getXoaHosts:getXoaHos.description: Use this data source to filter Xenorchestra hosts by certain criteria (name_label, tags) for use in other resources.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaHosts.

poolId.description: The pool id used to filter the resulting hosts by.

sortBy.description: The host field to sort the results by (id and name_label are supported).

sortOrder.description: Valid options are `asc` or `desc` and sort order is applied to `sort_by` argument.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaHosts.

hosts.description: The resulting hosts after applying the argument filtering.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

master.description: The primary host of the pool.

poolId.description: The pool id used to filter the resulting hosts by.

sortBy.description: The host field to sort the results by (id and name_label are supported).

sortOrder.description: Valid options are `asc` or `desc` and sort order is applied to `sort_by` argument.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaNetwork.

bridge.description: The name of the bridge network interface.

nameLabel.description: The name of the network.

poolId.description: The pool the network is associated with.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaNetwork.

bridge.description: The name of the bridge network interface.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nameLabel.description: The name of the network.

poolId.description: The pool the network is associated with.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaPif.

device.description: The name of the network device. Examples include eth0, eth1, etc. See `ifconfig` for possible devices.

hostId.description: The ID of the host that the PIF belongs to.

vlan.description: The VLAN the PIF belongs to.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaPif.

attached.description: If the PIF is attached to the network.

bondMaster.description: In case of a bond slave, the uuid of the bond master.

bondSlaves.description: In case of a bond master, the PIFs (uuid) that are used for this bond.

device.description: The name of the network device. Examples include eth0, eth1, etc. See `ifconfig` for possible devices.

host.description: The host the PIF is associated with.

hostId.description: The ID of the host that the PIF belongs to.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

isBondMaster.description: True if this PIF is a bond master.

isBondSlave.description: True if this PIF is a bond slave.

network.description: The network the PIF is associated with.

poolId.description: The pool the PIF is associated with.

vlan.description: The VLAN the PIF belongs to.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaPool.

nameLabel.description: The name_label of the pool to look up.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaPool.

cpus.description: CPU information about the pool. The 'cores' key will contain the number of cpu cores and the 'sockets' key will contain the number of sockets.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

master.description: The id of the primary instance in the pool.

nameLabel.description: The name_label of the pool to look up.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaResourceSet.

name.description: The name of the resource set to look up.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaResourceSet.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name of the resource set to look up.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaStorageRepository.

nameLabel.description: The name of the storage repository to look up

poolId.description: The Id of the pool the storage repository exists on.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaStorageRepository.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nameLabel.description: The name of the storage repository to look up

poolId.description: The Id of the pool the storage repository exists on.

srType.description: The type of storage repository (lvm, udev, iso, user, etc).

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

usage.description: The current usage for this storage repository.

uuid.description: uuid of the storage repository. This is equivalent to the id.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaTemplate.

nameLabel.description: The name of the template to look up.

poolId.description: The id of the pool that the template belongs to.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaTemplate.

bootFirmware.description: The boot firmware settings of the template.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nameLabel.description: The name of the template to look up.

poolId.description: The id of the pool that the template belongs to.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaUser.

searchInSession.description: A boolean which will search for the user in the current session (`session.getUser` Xen Orchestra RPC call). This allows a non admin user to look up their own user account.

username.description: The username of the XO user.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaUser.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

searchInSession.description: A boolean which will search for the user in the current session (`session.getUser` Xen Orchestra RPC call). This allows a non admin user to look up their own user account.

username.description: The username of the XO user.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaVdi.

nameLabel.description: The name of the VDI to look up.

poolId.description: The ID of the pool the VDI belongs to. This is useful if you have a VDI with the same name on different pools.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaVdi.

nameLabel.description: The name of the VDI to look up.

parent.description: The ID of the parent VDI if one exists. An example of when a VDI will have a parent is when it was created from a VM fast clone.

poolId.description: The ID of the pool the VDI belongs to. This is useful if you have a VDI with the same name on different pools.

tags.description: The tags (labels) applied to the given entity. Not used for filtering if empty.

xenorchestra:index/getXoaVms:getXoaVms.description: Use this data source to filter Xenorchestra VMs by certain criteria (pool_id, power_state or host) for use in other resources.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getXoaVms.

poolId.description: The ID of the pool the VM belongs to.

powerState.description: The power state of the vms. (Running, Halted)

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getXoaVms.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

poolId.description: The ID of the pool the VM belongs to.

powerState.description: The power state of the vms. (Running, Halted)

vms.description: A list of information for all vms found in this pool.
